subject: Re: [junit] Junit and RMI, please help ...
msgSnippet: ... Hmm... this is a good question. I m guessing this the real source of your desire to test  right? Unfortunately this isn t one I know off the top of my
messageBody:
On Wednesday, April 2, 2003, at 05:26 PM, skss2002@... wrote:

> I thought if the client is crashed and his connection is lost, the
> value that
> the object reference 'clientObject' points to must be null.

Hmm... this is a good question. I'm guessing this the real source of
your desire to test right?

Unfortunately this isn't one I know off the top of my head. To figure
it out, I would recommend writing a totally orthogonal spike.

Possibly something as simple as a dedicated server with two manually
driven clients.

-- Levi


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
